info.description:
This API provides a suite of methods to search for Products.

**NOTE** - It is **HIGHLY RECOMMENDED** that this documentation be used in conjunction with the Search Reference application which is available at the relative URL reference **/api/search/reference**.   The Product Search APIs described in this API suite typicallyn use a faceted navigation system.   This means the result set itself contains dynamically generated navigation URLs which allow runtime discovery.

Therefore whilst this product documentation accurately describes the structure of the API and how to use it, using the reference application will complement understanding of the API
info.title: Product Search API

get.description:
This API provides a faceted search alongside a traditional text search. 

This is achieve by the API response support a faceted navigation system in addition to the usual set of product search results.

This allows users to narrow down search results by applying multiple filters such as 'Wine Country of Origin',  'Grape Type',  'Product Rating' and 'Price'.

parameters.name: navigationPath
parameters.description:
The navigationPath allows a user to 'refine' their search so that they can drill-down to their chosen selection of products.

The list of available navigationPaths is generated dynamically in the response payload.

*For example:-* 
- A user might typically start at the root of the navigation tree by specifying a request of */api/search/product/facetedsearch/*.   The response payload will offer a set refinements to the navigationPath within the **GuidedNavigation** object property

- The user might then choose one of the refined navigationPath results */api/search/reference/Pinot-Noir/_/N-1z141s7*  to return a subset of products which are Pinot Noir wines.  The response payload will then offer a further set refinements to this selection with the **GuidedNavigation** object property

- The user can then reptitively select further refinements.

parameters.name: Ntt
parameters.description:
**Search Term.** *(Ntt)*

This allows a user to perform a traditional 'free text' search.

This can be used in preference to,  or in combination with the faceted navigation system.

parameters.name: Ns
parameters.description:
**Sort Parameter** *(Ns)*.

This allows the user to sort the Search Results using one of the supported search values.
Whilst an example is given in this documentation,  it should be noted that the list of supported search values is dynamically configured.

The current set of values can be determined by inspecting the **sortOptions** object property in the response payload

**Record Offset Number** *(No)*.

The record offset number is used in combination with the **Records Per Page** (a.k.a Page Size) parameter to achieve paging.

An initial response always returns a first page of result which typically consists of records 0-9
Therefore specifying **No** with a value of 10 would returns the next set of records.

Assuming a page size of 10,  this equates to a page down operation.

parameters.name: Nrpp
parameters.description:
**Records Per Page** *(Nrpp)   a.k.a* **Page Size*.

The number of records returned in a given query

This is used in combination with the **Record Offset Number** (a.k.a Page Size) parameter to achieve paging.  By default 10 records are returned.

It is recommended keeping this figures set at a value of between 10 and 50 to ensure better performance.

422.description: A validation error occured when calling this method.  For example it may be that the supplied account Id was invalid or was unauthorized for this user.

product.description.example: Grab this while you can – a fabulous, super lime fresh Aussie Sauvignon with three Trophies and five Golds. It’s from a 5-Star winemaker in ocean cooled Margaret River, and an exclusive too. Intense, citrusy, minerally with a hint of exotic fruit.

product.webHeadline.example: Three Trophies, five Golds for this terrific, tropical-fresh Sauvignon from premium Margaret River

product.longDescription.example: If you love the bold, fruit first character of Aussie Shiraz, and you’re looking to expand your horizons, try branching out to the boutique regions. McLaren Vale and Barossa are famous around the world for their seriously good Shiraz, but with popularity like that there’s always a price tag. The smarter thing to do is head a few miles down the road to Langhorne Creek, a region becoming known as Australia’s home of the small family winery. It’s also famous for the rich quality of its classic Shiraz, which were particularly luscious in 2017. Long, slow ripening resulted in the perfect mix of fruit flavour and freshness. From a highly acclaimed family winery, this Shiraz is packed with spicy blackberry fruit. Great with roasts and cheeses.

product.description.example: Here’s an Aussie Shiraz that’s got it all. It’s a juicy, small batch stunner from a boutique region that remains off the beaten track for most wine lovers in the UK. This Langhorne Creek gem offers velvety depths of smoky black fruit with elegance.

product.webHeadline.example: Smooth, blackberry-rich, premium Shiraz from an Aussie region that remains below the radar
